title: Tug Of War
body: Tug Of War Was An Olympic Event From 19001920 And Part Of The Summer Games Considered Part Of The Athletics Program Great Britain Was Awarded The Most Medals In The Event With Five Including Two Golds

title: 200ft Putt
body: In 1981 Sir Terry Wogan Wowed The Golfing World By Sinking A 200 Ft Putt At The Gleneagles Golf Course While Not The Longest Verified Putt In History It Is The Longest Televised Putt Well Done Sir Terry

title: 11 Hour Tennis Match
body: The Longest Tennis Match Took Place At Wimbledon 2010 When John Isner Of The Us Beat Nicolar Mahut Of France In A Match Which Lasted For 11 Hours 5 Minutes The Isner–mahut Match At The 2010 Wimbledon Championships Holds The Record For The Longest Tennis Match Both In Time And Games Played

title: Men Only
body: The First Modern Olympic Games Were Held In Athens Greece In 1896 There Were 311 Male But No Female Competitors Women Competed For The First Time At The 1900 Games In Paris

title: Worlds Oldest
body: Sheffield Fc Is The World’s Oldest Football Club Founded In 1857 The Club Is Officially Recognised By Fifa As Being The Oldest Association Football Club In The World Well I Never

title: Ancient Olympics
body: The Prize For Event Winners In The Ancient Olympics Was An Olive Branch Wreath No Gold Medals But A Simple Wreath Made From The Branches And Leaves Of An Olive Tree Sometimes Left Natural Often Sprayed Gold

title: Tennis Strings
body: Due To Its Softness And Resilience Animal Intestine Mainly From Sheep Cow Or Goat Used To Be The Most Commonly Used Material To Make Tennis Strings The Natural Strings Are Produced By Drying Fibres Extracted From Part Of The Intestine Which Contains Collagen This Gives Elasticity

title: Japans National Sport
body: The National Sport Of Japan Is Sumo Wrestling Sumo Is A Competitive Full Contact Sport Where One Wrestler Tries To Force The Other Out Of The Ring Or To Touch The Ground With Anything Other Than The Soles Of His Feet

title: Badminton Shuttlecock
body: The Weight Of The Shuttlecock Used In Badminton Is About 1719 Ounces It Usually Lasts For No More Than Two Games The Heavier The Shuttlecock The Faster It Flies They Also Fly Faster In Higher Temperatures And At Higher Altitudes

title: Heard This
body: The Boy Who Coxed The Winning Pair In The Rowing Events At The 1900 Olympics Is Believed To Be Only 7 Years Old

title: Ouch
body: The Grass At Wimbledon Was Kept Two Inches Long Until 1949 When An English Tennis Player Was Bitten By A Snake 8mm Is The Optimum Grass Length For Present Day Play At Wimbledon

title: Our Capital City
body: London United Kingdom Hosted The Summer Olympics In 1908 1948 And 2012 That Makes London The Only City To Host The Event On Three Occasions

title: Jordan Spieth
body: Jordan Spieth Won 61867 Less At The Masters Than Arnold Palmer Won In His Entire Career

title: Bull And Jerry R
body: Bulls And White Sox Owner Jerry Reinsdorf Continued To Pay Michael Jordan His Reported 4 Million Basketball Salary While He Was Experimenting With Baseball

title: Michael Phelps
body: If Michael Phelps Were A Country He’d Rank No 35 On The Alltime Olympic Gold Medal List Ahead Of 97 Nations

title: Bill Russell
body: Wilt Chamberlain Didn’t Win Mvp The Year He Scored 504 Points And Grabbed 229 Rebounds Per Game Bill Russell Did

title: Buffalo Bills
body: The Buffalo Bills Haven’t Made The Playoffs Since Bill Clinton Was President

title: Roger Bannister
body: Roger Bannister Held The World Record In The Mile For Exactly 46 Days

title: Federer
body: “Federer” Can Be Typed Entirely With The Left Hand

title: Curious Fact
body: The Average Golf Ball Has 336 Dimples

title: Venus Williams
body: Venus Williams 7 Grand Slams Has Been Ranked No 1 In The Wta Rankings For 17 Weeks More Than A Full Year Less 56 Weeks Less Than Caroline Wozniacki 0 Grand Slams

title: Tim Tebows
body: Six Of Tim Tebow’s Seven Wins With The Miracle 2011 Denver Broncos Were Of The Comefrombehind Variety

title: Cy Young
body: If Threetime Cy Young Winner Clayton Kershaw Were To Break Young’s Record Of 511 Wins He’d Need To Stay At His Current Pace For The Next 41 Years Until He Were 68 Years Old

title: Anna Kopchovsky
body: Anna Kopchovsky The First Woman To Cycle Around The World In 1894 Had Only Learned How To Cycle A Few Days Before She Set Off She Covered The Entire Distance In 15 Months And Received A Reward Of 10000 Dollars

title: Qatar
body: The 2022 World Soccer Championship Will Be Opened In Lusail Qatar A City Which Did Not Exist Till Recently

title: Film Hoosiers
body: Jimmy Chitwood The Hero Of The Film Hoosiers Only Has Four Lines In The Entire Movie

title: Alan Shephard
body: The Two Golf Balls Alan Shephard Hit On The Moon With A Sixiron One That Went Into A Crater Another That “Sailed For Miles And Miles” Are Still There

title: 1950 World Cup
body: When The Americans Defeated Favorite England In The 1950 World Cup The Story Goes That Many Newspapers Around The World Believed The 10 Score To Be A Typo And Instead Printed That England Won 101

title: In Mlb
body: Only Three Active Players Are In The Top 50 On The Alltime Mlb Home Run List Yet 27 Of The Top 50 Have Played In The Past 20 Years

title: The Phillippines
body: The Phillippines Has Competed In The Most Summer Olympics 20 Without Winning A Gold Medal

title: Babe Ruth
body: Babe Ruth Only Won Four World Series In 15 Seasons With The New York Yankees

title: Yogi Berra
body: Yogi Berra Won 13 World Series In 18 Seasons With The Yanks

title: Princess Royal
body: Princess Anne Daughter Of Queen Elizabeth Ii Did Not Have To Undergo Gender Verification At The 1976 Olympics Due To “Royal Courtesy”

title: The 2010 Olympics
body: When Asked Why He Didn’t Win Gold In Cross Country At The 2010 Olympics Norwegian Skier Oddbjoern Hjelmeset Said “I Think I Have Seen Too Much Porn In The Last 14 Days”

title: Sammy Sosa
body: Sammy Sosa Has Three Of The Eight 60home Run Seasons In Baseball History

title: T Woods
body: Tiger Woods Once Made 142 Straight Cuts Topping Jack Nicklaus’ Record By 37 And Routinely Leading The Nextbest Active Player By 100 Or More Tournaments This Is One Of Tiger’s Most Underrated Stats

title: The Jockey
body: The Phrase About Winning Something “Hands Down” Originally Referred To A Jockey Who Won A Race Without Whipping His Horse Or Pulling Back The Reins

title: Olympics First Modern
body: At The First Modern Olympics Winners Were Awarded Silver Medals

title: Barry Bonds
body: In 2004 Barry Bonds Was Intentionally Walked 120 Times Which Is More Than 25 Times Higher Than The Longtime Record Held By Willie Mccovey 45 In 1969 Only Six Players In The Nl That Year Walked That Many Times In Total

title: 1989 French
body: Teenager Michael Chang Hit An Underhand Serve To Defeat World No 1 Ivan Lendl En Route To His Shocking 1989 French Open Title

title: R Hernderson
body: Rickey Henderson’s Stolen Base Total 1406 Is Almost Three Times As High As The Active Sb Leader Ichiro 487

title: World War Ii
body: Among Ted Williams’ Many Records He Set A Student Gunnery Record As A World War Ii Pilot The Test Emphasizes Reflexes Coordination And Visual Reaction Time And Still Stood As Of 2002

title: C Evert
body: Chris Evert Won 125straight Matches On Clay From Aug 12 1973 To May 12 1979 Amazingly Though That Run Included Just Two French Open Titles

title: Conan Doyle
body: Sir Arthur Conan Doyle The Creator Of Sherlock Holmes Played Goalie For The Amateur Portsmouth Association Football Club Which Would Eventually Become The Portsmouth Professional Team That Won The Fa Cup In 2008

title: World Record
body: The Men’s Long Jump World Record Has Been Broken Once Since 1969

title: B Beamons
body: Bob Beamon’s 1968 Olympic Record In The Long Jump Would Have Won The 2012 Olympics By Almost Two Feet

title: Triple Crown
body: Horse Racing’s Triple Crown Has Been Achieved Just Three Times Since 1949 All Within A Six Year Span In The Mid1970s Secretariat 1973 Seattle Slew 1977 Affirmed 1978 That’s Three In Six Years And Zero In The Other 60

title: Olympic Games
body: There Have Been Three Olympic Games Held In Countries That No Longer Exist

title: Greece
body: Greece Is The Only Country To Have Participated In Every Olympics Under Its Own Flag

title: R Wallace
body: Rasheed Wallace Had His 2004 Detroit Pistons Championship Ring Resized To Fit His Middle Finger
